00020 
00021 #include <avr/io.h>
00022 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 
00025 #include "i2c.h"
00026 
00027 // Standard I2C bit rates are:
00028 // 100KHz for slow speed
00029 // 400KHz for high speed
00030 
00031 //#define I2C_DEBUG
00032 //#define TWPS0
00033 
00034 // I2C state and address variables
00035 static volatile eI2cStateType I2cState;
00036 static unsigned char I2cDeviceAddrRW;
00037 // send/transmit buffer (outgoing data)
00038 static unsigned char I2cSendData[I2C_SEND_DATA_BUFFER_SIZE];
00039 static unsigned char I2cSendDataIndex;
00040 static unsigned char I2cSendDataLength;
00041 // receive buffer (incoming data)
00042 static unsigned char I2cReceiveData[I2C_RECEIVE_DATA_BUFFER_SIZE];
00043 static unsigned char I2cReceiveDataIndex;
00044 static unsigned char I2cReceiveDataLength;
00045 
00046 // function pointer to i2c receive routine
00048 // is addressed as a slave for writing
00049 static void (*i2cSlaveReceive)(unsigned char receiveDataLength, unsigned char* recieveData);
00051 // is addressed as a slave for reading
00052 static unsigned char (*i2cSlaveTransmit)(unsigned char transmitDataLengthMax, unsigned char* transmitData);
00053 
00054 // functions
00055 void i2c_init(void)
00056 {
00057         // set pull-up resistors on I2C bus pins
00058         //sbi(PORTC, 0);        // i2c SCL on ATmega163,323,16,32,etc
00059         //sbi(PORTC, 1);        // i2c SDA on ATmega163,323,16,32,etc
00060         sbi(PORTD, 0);  // i2c SCL on ATmega128,64
00061         sbi(PORTD, 1);  // i2c SDA on ATmega128,64
00062 
00063         // clear SlaveReceive and SlaveTransmit handler to null
00064         i2cSlaveReceive = 0;
00065         i2cSlaveTransmit = 0;
00066         // set i2c bit rate to 100KHz
00067         i2cSetBitrate(100);
00068         // enable TWI (two-wire interface)
00069         sbi(TWCR, TWEN);
00070         // set state
00071         I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00072         // enable TWI interrupt and slave address ACK
00073         //sbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00074         sbi(TWCR, TWEA);
00075         //outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00076         // enable interrupts
00077         //sei();
00078 }
00079 
00080 void i2cSetBitrate(unsigned int bitrateKHz)
00081 {
00082         unsigned char bitrate_div;
00083         // set i2c bitrate
00084         // SCL freq = F_CPU/(16+2*TWBR))
00085         #ifdef TWPS0
00086                 // for processors with additional bitrate division (mega128)
00087                 // SCL freq = F_CPU/(16+2*TWBR*4^TWPS)
00088                 // set TWPS to zero
00089                 cbi(TWSR,0);
00090                 cbi(TWSR,1);
00091         #endif
00092         // calculate bitrate division   
00093         bitrate_div = ((F_CPU/1000l)/bitrateKHz);
00094         if(bitrate_div >= 16)
00095                 bitrate_div = (bitrate_div-16)/2;
00096         outb(TWBR, bitrate_div);
00097 }

00100 void i2cSetLocalDeviceAddr(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char genCallEn)
00101 {
00102         // set local device address (used in slave mode only)
00103         outb(TWAR, ((deviceAddr&0xFE) | (genCallEn?1:0)) );
00104 }

00106 void i2cSetSlaveReceiveHandler(void (*i2cSlaveRx_func)(unsigned char receiveDataLength, unsigned char* recieveData))
00107 {
00108         i2cSlaveReceive = i2cSlaveRx_func;
00109 }
00110 
00111 void i2cSetSlaveTransmitHandler(unsigned char (*i2cSlaveTx_func)(unsigned char transmitDataLengthMax, unsigned char* transmitData))
00112 {
00113         i2cSlaveTransmit = i2cSlaveTx_func;
00114 }
00115 
00116 inline void i2cSendStart(void)
00117 {
00118         // send start condition
00119         outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWSTA));
00120 }
00121 
00122 inline void i2cSendStop(void)
00123 {
00124         // transmit stop condition
00125         // leave with TWEA on for slave receiving
00126         outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA)|BV(TWSTO));
00127 }
00128 
00129 inline void i2cWaitForComplete(void)
00130 {
00131         // wait for i2c interface to complete operation
00132         while( !(inb(TWCR) & BV(TWINT)) );
00133 }
00134 
00135 inline void i2cSendByte(unsigned char data)
00136 {
00137         // save data to the TWDR
00138         outb(TWDR, data);
00139         // begin send
00140         outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00141 }
00142 
00143 inline void i2cReceiveByte(unsigned char ackFlag)
00144 {
00145         // begin receive over i2c
00146         if( ackFlag )
00147         {
00148                 // ackFlag = TRUE: ACK the recevied data
00149                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00150         }
00151         else
00152         {
00153                 // ackFlag = FALSE: NACK the recevied data
00154                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00155         }
00156 }
00157 
00158 inline unsigned char i2cGetReceivedByte(void)
00159 {
00160         // retieve received data byte from i2c TWDR
00161         return( inb(TWDR) );
00162 }
00163 
00164 inline unsigned char i2cGetStatus(void)
00165 {
00166         // retieve current i2c status from i2c TWSR
00167         return( inb(TWSR) );
00168 }
00169 
00170 void i2cMasterSend(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char length, unsigned char* data)
00171 {
00172         unsigned char i;
00173         // wait for interface to be ready
00174         while(I2cState);
00175         // set state
00176         I2cState = I2C_MASTER_TX;
00177         // save data
00178         I2cDeviceAddrRW = ((deviceAddr<<1) & 0xFE);     // RW cleared: write operation
00179         for(i=0; i<length; i++)
00180                 I2cSendData[i] = *data++;
00181         I2cSendDataIndex = 0;
00182         I2cSendDataLength = length;
00183         // send start condition
00184         i2cSendStart();
00185 }
00186 
00187 void i2cMasterReceive(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char length, unsigned char* data)
00188 {
00189         unsigned char i;
00190         // wait for interface to be ready
00191         while(I2cState);
00192         // set state
00193         I2cState = I2C_MASTER_RX;
00194         // save data
00195         I2cDeviceAddrRW = ((deviceAddr<<1)|0x01);       // RW set: read operation
00196         I2cReceiveDataIndex = 0;
00197         I2cReceiveDataLength = length;
00198         // send start condition
00199         i2cSendStart();
00200         // wait for data
00201         while(I2cState);
00202         // return data
00203         for(i=0; i<length; i++)
00204                 *data++ = I2cReceiveData[i];
00205 }
00206 
00207 unsigned char i2cMasterSendNI(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char length, unsigned char* data)
00208 {
00209         unsigned char retval = I2C_OK;
00210 
00211         // disable TWI interrupt
00212         cbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00213 
00214         // send start condition
00215         i2cSendStart();
00216         i2cWaitForComplete();
00217 
00218         // send device address with write
00219         i2cSendByte((deviceAddr<<1) & 0xFE );
00220         i2cWaitForComplete();
00221 
00222         // check if device is present and live
00223         if( inb(TWSR) == TW_MT_SLA_ACK)
00224         {
00225                 // send data
00226                 while(length)
00227                 {
00228                         i2cSendByte( *data++ );
00229                         i2cWaitForComplete();
00230                         length--;
00231                 }
00232         }
00233         else
00234         {
00235                 // device did not ACK it's address,
00236                 // data will not be transferred
00237                 // return error
00238                 retval = I2C_ERROR_NODEV;
00239         }
00240 
00241         // transmit stop condition
00242         // leave with TWEA on for slave receiving
00243         i2cSendStop();
00244         while( !(inb(TWCR) & BV(TWSTO)) );
00245 
00246         // enable TWI interrupt
00247         sbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00248 
00249         return retval;
00250 }
00251 
00252 unsigned char i2cMasterReceiveNI(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char length, unsigned char *data)
00253 {
00254         unsigned char retval = I2C_OK;
00255         
00256         // disable TWI interrupt
00257         cbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00258 
00259         // send start condition
00260         i2cSendStart();
00261         i2cWaitForComplete();
00262         i2cSendByte(0xD0);
00263         i2cWaitForComplete();
00264         i2cSendByte(0x00);
00265         i2cWaitForComplete();
00266 
00267         // send start condition
00268         i2cSendStart();
00269         i2cWaitForComplete();
00270 
00271         // send device address with read
00272         i2cSendByte((deviceAddr<<1) | 0x01);
00273         i2cWaitForComplete();   
00274 
00275         // check if device is present and live
00276         if(inb(TWSR) == TW_MR_SLA_ACK)
00277         {
00278                 // accept receive data and ack it
00279                 while(length > 1)
00280                 {
00281                         i2cReceiveByte(TRUE);
00282                         i2cWaitForComplete();
00283                         *data++ = i2cGetReceivedByte();
00284                         //printf("FIRST->0x%X\n",i2cGetReceivedByte());
00285                         // decrement length
00286                         length--;
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 // accept receive data and nack it (last-byte signal)
00290                 i2cReceiveByte(FALSE);
00291                 i2cWaitForComplete();
00292                 *data++ = i2cGetReceivedByte();
00293                 //printf("SECOND->0x%X\n",i2cGetReceivedByte());
00294         }
00295         else
00296         {
00297                 // device did not ACK it's address,
00298                 // data will not be transferred
00299                 // return error
00300                 retval = I2C_ERROR_NODEV;
00301         }
00302 
00303         // transmit stop condition
00304         // leave with TWEA on for slave receiving
00305         i2cSendStop();
00306 
00307         // enable TWI interrupt
00308         sbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00309 
00310         return retval;
00311 }

00313 void i2cMasterTransferNI(unsigned char deviceAddr, unsigned char sendlength, unsigned char* senddata, unsigned char receivelength, unsigned char* receivedata)

00316         cbi(TWCR, TWIE);
00317 
00318         // send start condition
00319         i2cSendStart();

00321 
00322         // if there's data to be sent, do it

00326                 i2cSendByte( deviceAddr & 0xFE );

00333                         i2cWaitForComplete();

00335                 }
00336         }

00374 
00376 SIGNAL(SIG_2WIRE_SERIAL)
00377 {
00378         // read status bits
00379         unsigned char status = inb(TWSR) & TWSR_STATUS_MASK;
00380 
00381         switch(status)
00382         {
00383         // Master General
00384         case TW_START:                                          // 0x08: Sent start condition
00385         case TW_REP_START:                                      // 0x10: Sent repeated start condition
00386                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00387                 printf("I2C: M->START\r\n");
00388                 #endif
00389                 // send device address
00390                 i2cSendByte(I2cDeviceAddrRW);
00391                 break;
00392         
00393         // Master Transmitter & Receiver status codes
00394         case TW_MT_SLA_ACK:                                     // 0x18: Slave address acknowledged
00395         case TW_MT_DATA_ACK:                            // 0x28: Data acknowledged
00396                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00397                 printf("I2C: MT->SLA_ACK or DATA_ACK\r\n");
00398                 #endif
00399                 if(I2cSendDataIndex < I2cSendDataLength)
00400                 {
00401                         // send data
00402                         i2cSendByte( I2cSendData[I2cSendDataIndex++] );
00403                 }
00404                 else
00405                 {
00406                         // transmit stop condition, enable SLA ACK
00407                                 i2cSendStop();
00408                                                         // set state
00409                                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00410                 }
00411                 break;
00412         case TW_MR_DATA_NACK:                           // 0x58: Data received, NACK reply issued
00413                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00414                 printf("I2C: MR->DATA_NACK\r\n");
00415                 #endif
00416                 // store final received data byte
00417                 I2cReceiveData[I2cReceiveDataIndex++] = inb(TWDR);
00418                 // continue to transmit STOP condition
00419         case TW_MR_SLA_NACK:                            // 0x48: Slave address not acknowledged
00420         case TW_MT_SLA_NACK:                            // 0x20: Slave address not acknowledged
00421         case TW_MT_DATA_NACK:                           // 0x30: Data not acknowledged
00422                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00423                 printf("I2C:  or MT->DATA_NACK\r\n");
00424                 #endif
00425                         // transmit stop condition, enable SLA ACK
00426                         i2cSendStop();
00427                 
00428                 // set state
00429                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00430                 break;
00431         case TW_MT_ARB_LOST:                            // 0x38: Bus arbitration lost
00432         //case TW_MR_ARB_LOST:                          // 0x38: Bus arbitration lost
00433                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00434                 printf("I2C: MT->ARB_LOST\r\n");
00435                 #endif
00436                 // release bus
00437                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00438                 // set state
00439                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00440                 // release bus and transmit start when bus is free
00441                 //outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWSTA));
00442                 break;
00443         case TW_MR_DATA_ACK:                            // 0x50: Data acknowledged
00444                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00445                 printf("I2C: MR->DATA_ACK\r\n");
00446                 #endif
00447                 // store received data byte
00448                 I2cReceiveData[I2cReceiveDataIndex++] = inb(TWDR);
00449                 printf("DATA -> %i\n",I2cReceiveData[I2cReceiveDataIndex-1]);
00450                 // fall-through to see if more bytes will be received
00451         case TW_MR_SLA_ACK:                                     // 0x40: Slave address acknowledged
00452                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00453                 
00454                 printf("I2C: MR->SLA_ACK\r\n");
00455                 
00456                 #endif
00457                 if(I2cReceiveDataIndex < (I2cReceiveDataLength-1))
00458                         // data byte will be received, reply with ACK (more bytes in transfer)
00459                         i2cReceiveByte(TRUE);
00460                 else
00461                         // data byte will be received, reply with NACK (final byte in transfer)
00462                         i2cReceiveByte(FALSE);
00463                 break;
00464 
00465         // Slave Receiver status codes
00466         case TW_SR_SLA_ACK:                                     // 0x60: own SLA+W has been received, ACK has been returned
00467         case TW_SR_ARB_LOST_SLA_ACK:            // 0x68: own SLA+W has been received, ACK has been returned
00468         case TW_SR_GCALL_ACK:                           // 0x70:     GCA+W has been received, ACK has been returned
00469         case TW_SR_ARB_LOST_GCALL_ACK:          // 0x78:     GCA+W has been received, ACK has been returned
00470                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00471 
00472                 printf("I2C: SR->SLA_ACK\r\n");
00473                 
00474                 #endif
00475                 // we are being addressed as slave for writing (data will be received from master)
00476                 // set state
00477                 I2cState = I2C_SLAVE_RX;
00478                 // prepare buffer
00479                 I2cReceiveDataIndex = 0;
00480                 // receive data byte and return ACK
00481                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00482                 break;
00483         case TW_SR_DATA_ACK:                            // 0x80: data byte has been received, ACK has been returned
00484         case TW_SR_GCALL_DATA_ACK:                      // 0x90: data byte has been received, ACK has been returned
00485                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00486                 printf("I2C: SR->DATA_ACK\r\n");
00487                 #endif
00488                 // get previously received data byte
00489                 I2cReceiveData[I2cReceiveDataIndex++] = inb(TWDR);
00490                 // check receive buffer status
00491                 if(I2cReceiveDataIndex < I2C_RECEIVE_DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00492                 {
00493                         // receive data byte and return ACK
00494                         i2cReceiveByte(TRUE);
00495                         //outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00496                 }
00497                 else
00498                 {
00499                         // receive data byte and return NACK
00500                         i2cReceiveByte(FALSE);
00501                         //outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00502                 }
00503                 break;
00504         case TW_SR_DATA_NACK:                           // 0x88: data byte has been received, NACK has been returned
00505         case TW_SR_GCALL_DATA_NACK:                     // 0x98: data byte has been received, NACK has been returned
00506                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00507                 printf("I2C: SR->DATA_NACK\r\n");
00508                 #endif
00509                 // receive data byte and return NACK
00510                 i2cReceiveByte(FALSE);
00511                 //outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00512                 break;
00513         case TW_SR_STOP:                                        // 0xA0: STOP or REPEATED START has been received while addressed as slave
00514                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00515                 
00516                 printf("I2C: SR->SR_STOP\r\n");
00517                 
00518                 #endif
00519                 // switch to SR mode with SLA ACK
00520                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00521                 // i2c receive is complete, call i2cSlaveReceive
00522                 if(i2cSlaveReceive) i2cSlaveReceive(I2cReceiveDataIndex, I2cReceiveData);
00523                 // set state
00524                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00525                 break;
00526 
00527         // Slave Transmitter
00528         case TW_ST_SLA_ACK:                                     // 0xA8: own SLA+R has been received, ACK has been returned
00529         case TW_ST_ARB_LOST_SLA_ACK:            // 0xB0:     GCA+R has been received, ACK has been returned
00530                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00531                 
00532                 printf("I2C: ST->SLA_ACK\r\n");
00533                 
00534                 #endif
00535                 // we are being addressed as slave for reading (data must be transmitted back to master)
00536                 // set state
00537                 I2cState = I2C_SLAVE_TX;
00538                 // request data from application
00539                 if(i2cSlaveTransmit) I2cSendDataLength = i2cSlaveTransmit(I2C_SEND_DATA_BUFFER_SIZE, I2cSendData);
00540                 // reset data index
00541                 I2cSendDataIndex = 0;
00542                 // fall-through to transmit first data byte
00543         case TW_ST_DATA_ACK:                            // 0xB8: data byte has been transmitted, ACK has been received
00544                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00545                 
00546                 printf("I2C: ST->DATA_ACK\r\n");
00547                 
00548                 #endif
00549                 // transmit data byte
00550                 outb(TWDR, I2cSendData[I2cSendDataIndex++]);
00551                 if(I2cSendDataIndex < I2cSendDataLength)
00552                         // expect ACK to data byte
00553                         outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00554                 else
00555                         // expect NACK to data byte
00556                         outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT));
00557                 break;
00558         case TW_ST_DATA_NACK:                           // 0xC0: data byte has been transmitted, NACK has been received
00559         case TW_ST_LAST_DATA:                           // 0xC8:
00560                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00561                 
00562                 printf("I2C: ST->DATA_NACK or LAST_DATA\r\n");
00563                 
00564                 #endif
00565                 // all done
00566                 // switch to open slave
00567                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWEA));
00568                 // set state
00569                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00570                 break;
00571 
00572         // Misc
00573         case TW_NO_INFO:                                        // 0xF8: No relevant state information
00574                 // do nothing
00575                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00576                 printf("I2C: NO_INFO\r\n");
00577                 #endif
00578                 break;
00579         case TW_BUS_ERROR:                                      // 0x00: Bus error due to illegal start or stop condition
00580                 #ifdef I2C_DEBUG
00581                 
00582                 printf("I2C: BUS_ERROR\r\n");
00583                 
00584                 #endif
00585                 // reset internal hardware and release bus
00586                 outb(TWCR, (inb(TWCR)&TWCR_CMD_MASK)|BV(TWINT)|BV(TWSTO)|BV(TWEA));
00587                 // set state
00588                 I2cState = I2C_IDLE;
00589                 break;
00590         }
00591 }
00592 
00593 eI2cStateType i2cGetState(void)
00594 {
00595         return I2cState;
00596 }
